revised_title: A Comparison of Alternative Methods for Solving the Structure of Factor V
tldr: The authors compared different methods for solving the structure of factor V, a protein involved in blood clotting. They found that the anomalous synthesis provided the best approximation for structure solution, while the heavy atom synthesis and Ps(u) function also showed promising results. The study highlights the importance of using various methods to determine protein structures accurately.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Protein Structure
